definition: a slug/sb with a runny nose
lower form of animal life, including insects, insect larvae, worms and similar creatures/CL:條|条[tiao2],隻|只[zhi1]/(fig.) person with a particular undesirable characteristic

sentences.english: Swarly the squishy slug softly sings some silly songs.
sentences.chinese: 軟軟的鼻涕蟲斯華利，在輕輕地唱着一些傻傻的歌。

sentences.english: “Like a slug,” Marina says flatly. “It’s disgusting.”
sentences.chinese: “像個鼻涕蟲，”瑪麗娜沒勁地說，“很噁心。”

sentences.english: Come on, slugger, I think I'll have some ice cream, too.
sentences.chinese: 來吧，鼻涕蟲，我也想喫點冰淇淋。

sentences.english: They then die of the infection, while the slug remains healthy.
sentences.chinese: 他們將死於感染，而“鼻涕蟲”則保持健康。

sentences.english: Inside the slug, about 1 percent of the amoebas turn into police.
sentences.chinese: “鼻涕蟲”內部，大約1%的阿米巴原蟲變成了警察。

sentences.english: Watch out for counterfeits. The slime from common slugs is of inferior quality.
sentences.chinese: 小心僞造產品，一般的鼻涕蟲的黏液質量非常爛的。

definition: armpit/also pr. [ge1 zhi5 wo1]/also written 夾肢窩|夹肢窝[ga1 zhi5 wo1]
to claw wildly/to scratch frantically/to arrest people indiscriminately
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to get hyped up in front of an audience/(of children) to play up in front of guests
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3
